author: scotsman.com
title: New law to tackle revenge porn published
text:
3
Have your say A NEW law to tackle the rise of so-called revenge porn has been introduced by the Scottish government in a move that will make it a criminal offence to publish explicit images of someone without their consent.
The abusive behaviour and sexual harm bill will also strengthen police powers to tackle domestic abuse, harassment and sexual offences.
It results in significant distress to victims and in extreme cases has resulted in people taking their own lives. Frank Mulholland Scotland’s top prosecutor, the Lord Advocate, welcomed the move to tackle the “form of insidious abuse” - often against women - which in some cases has led to people taking their own lives.
